meanings.definition: Hit someone on the head with a cosh.
meanings.sent1: He was coshing the thief to stop the robbery.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was caught coshing his victim in the alley.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy burglar ended up coshing himself by mistake.
meanings.sent4: The boxer's punch felt like a coshing blow to his opponent.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the coshing impact echoed in the dark street.

meanings.definition: The act of hitting someone on the head with a cosh.
meanings.sent1: The coshing of the intruder was necessary to protect the family.
meanings.sent2: The police arrested the suspect for the coshing of the victim.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit involved a hilarious mix-up with a fake coshing.
meanings.sent4: The coshing in the movie scene looked so realistic.
meanings.sent5: The coshing left a visible mark on the criminal's head.

meanings.definition: A heavy stick or bar used as a weapon.
meanings.sent1: The thug carried a dangerous coshing in his coat.
meanings.sent2: The gang member threatened the shopkeeper with a coshing.
meanings.sent3: The old detective always kept a trusty coshing in his car.
meanings.sent4: The coshing was hidden in the criminal's back pocket.
meanings.sent5: The coshing was made of solid metal for maximum impact.
